He attempts to open it with one great flourish. He fails however, knocking over the glasses on the table. The grou applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the doorbell rings and everyone looks up. The door opens and CHARLIE appears, arms outstretched, dresse as the ressurected Christ - with white robes, fake beard hair, and artificial wounds. His arms stretch out wider. The initial shock wears off and TONY greets him.  TONY (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE enters in mock holiness.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have come to create order... Scotch and water please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh. The rock music blares as CHARLIE walks to and fro blessing all in the room. TONY is delighted with the scene. CHARLIE sits at the kitchen table, TONY opposi him, and the others gather around. The party is getting noisier. TONY gives CHARLIE a glass of ice cubes. CHARLIE plays the part of a priest, during the Mass when the chal is filled with wine and water, TONY pours the scotch over his fingers first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE lifts his hands to touch the bottle as a priest would. He signifies that there is enough in the glass. TONY then repeats the same ritual with a bottle of soda-w  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May God be with you.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'And with your spirit.'  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing with his drink) Salute!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone drinks after repeating the toast. The crowd arou them begins to break up as CHARLIE and TONY begin to have fun with each other. TONY pulls down his mask, revealing skeleton death face which covers his own face except for mouth. It completes the Dough-boy uniform quite well.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking on the guise of an interviewer) 'Art thou the King of the Jews'?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Dost thou say this of thyself, or have others told thee of me?'
TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Am I a Jew? Thy own people and the chief priests have delivered thee to me. What hast thou done?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL and a few of the others gather around again as th continue.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world my followers would have fought that I might not be delivered to the Jews. But, as it is my kingdom is not from here.'  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thou art then a king?'  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thou sayest it; I am a king. This is why I was born and why I have come into this world, to bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears my voice.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY leans over towards CHARLIE.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'What is the truth?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others around them give mock applause. TONY smiles an nods his head to them. CHARLIE laughs. They drink. Someon hits CHARLIE on the back of the head. CHARLIE startled, looks up.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prophesy to us, oh Christ! Who is it that struck thee?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but God help him if he does it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is talking to MICHAEL. The conversation is seriou CHARLIE has not lost his sense of humor.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd be here.
MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he isn't. Nice...real nice.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be here. Look, take this for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands MICHAEL a twenty dollar bill from under his robe  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kiddin. The way it is now this isn't even interest for two hours.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting the bill back into his pocket) How much was the original loan again?  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $500. He borrowed that because he wanted to pay off his other loans... now, counting the interest...it's almost $3,000.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $3,000. Shit! Can we hold it at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, this is business.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (avoiding the issue) 'But I say to you, love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who persecute...'  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you who you can pray for... Next payday, I'll be at Tony's Place...Johnny better show or I find him and break his legs...and I mean it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the same manner) 'But I say to you not to resist the evildoer; on the contrary, if someone takes thy tunic, let him take thy cloak as well...to him who asks of thee, give; and from him who would borrow of thee do not turn away!
MICHAEL (EXASPERATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could at least show some respect and show his face, even if he doesn't have the money...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more serious now) 'Amen I say to thee, thou wilt not come out from it until thou hast paid the last penny.'  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud scream is heard from the bathroom.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone shoved a nude girl into the bathtub which is now filled with congealed red jello. The boys are laughing an shoving each other about roughly. CHARLIE comes out of th next room and walks along in a Christ like manner through the madness, his arms outstretched. One boy kneels and kisses the hem of his robe and CHARLIE blesses him. There is a great deal of pushing and shoving going on inside th bathroom and near the doorway. CHARLIE promises to save t sinner as he pushes his way through. He helps the girl remove the jello from her body and helps her out of the bathtub. It is obvious that she is quite stoned. She caresses him and they find themselves kissing. The others storm into the bathroom and grab CHARLIE.  EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blasphemy!...The anti-Christ! Crucify him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drag CHARLIE into the next room where, amidst all th shouting and laughing, the other members of the party are placing firecrackers on model airplanes, simulating their own "dog fight". They are flying the planes out the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE takes everything in stride trying to shout a few lines over their laughter.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Father...forgive them...for they know not...what they do...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings and TONY answers it. It is TERESA and she looks very worried.
TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie...? Charlie here...?  CUT TO:  BLACK & WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE and TERESA dash from a tenement doorway. CHARLIE still in beard and wig but his robes are open so they giv the effect of being a bulky overcoat.  TERESA (FRANTICALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building on the corner. That one! He's been on the roof a half hour now!  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't get excited. Don't get excited!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very late and the streets are deserted. At the corn of the building in question, a few of JOHNNY BOY'S friend cling to the wall for safety. When they see CHARLIE and TERESA they call out.  FRIENDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, stay there...He's crazy... He's got a 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA gets up against a wall. CHARLIE sends her down the block and she leaves reluctantly.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny it's me, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY can now be seen silhouetted against the moonli on the tenement roof. He has a gun in his hand.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come any closer!!!  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out stupid. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY fires a shot into the air. CHARLIE clings to t wall with the others. A moment later he makes a quick run for the doorway of the building across the street. He enters the building that leads to the roof.  BLACK & WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE has reached the roof.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie...pssst. Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs with glee.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you...crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps JOHNNY BOY on the back of the head.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...don't do that...I'm only scaring them.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bastard...you get your cousin half-sick over this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys below are still clinging to the walls of the building. JOHNNY is oblivious to CHARLIE'S statement.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a home made firecracker consisting of glass cigar tubing filled with gunpowder and a waxed fuse stick through the top layer of cork. He lights it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY tosses it over the building and it blows up in mid-air. The boys below rush madly away. Lights go on in the tenements around them. The explosion was quite loud.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.  JOHNNY BOY (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see them run!  BLACK & WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE and JOHNNY BOY are sneaking over a fence in an ol cemetary which is part of their neighborhood. It surround their church and dates back to the beginning of the 19th century. No one is buried there any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very quiet and dark. They sit and rest. CHARLIE is still in his makeup.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God Charlie...my arm still hurts from the car accident...that's why I didn't go to work. I swear it.  CHARLIE (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to help.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to work this week...I mean it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible for you to catch up on the loan now...the interest is going up...$3,000...do you realize that, flash?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Charlie...I didn't mean it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big deal...in the meantime, it's done...I'll still try to help you out...You know that...but you gotta show some effort...some respect... understand?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, you know the best way to take care of this whole mess.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  JOHNNY BOY (COAXING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had a little talk with your uncle...if anybody can do it, he can.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll help you out fine. That's the best way for you, not for me! I swear to God, I'll rip you open if my uncle ever hears a word about this. You understand? I don't care what happens, he doesn't find out. (MORE)
CHARLIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get involved with anything, you understand that? Nothing! I'm clean as far as you know...right?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take it easy. Will you relax.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I get for getting involved. Look, on pay-day at least show up at Tony's Place to meet him, ok? This way he doesn't think that you're trying to screw him. If you show good faith and save his face maybe we can talk and he'll take off the interest or make different payment arrangements or something... understand? I'm not asking I'm telling you!!  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY closes his eyes. CHARLIE looks at JOHNNY BOY a then looks at the cemetary in the moonlight. It seems totally apart from the city with the sirens and cars far the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stands and unravels his robes, preparing to take them off. He projects the image of Christ delivering a sermon. Music and laughter in the distance catches his attention. The lights and the music are coming from the t floor of a tenement building where a Puerto Rican family having a party. The sound echoes through the streets. Decorations are hanging and blowing away through the open windows. As CHARLIE watches a fight break out over one of the girls. Screams are heard. People run up and down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE has pulled off the robe. He now removes the beard and wig and has become himself again. He leans over to fi JOHNNY BOY fast asleep on a tomb.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Could you not, then, watch one hour with me?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wakes JOHNNY BOY up.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is sitting in the corner. The restaurant is in th same condition that it was the last time he was there. While CHARLIE waits for his uncle in his semi-private corner, a handful of old Mafiosi, invited by GIOVANNI, si at another table. GIOVANNI enters with MARIO. The old Mafiosi are greeted first. They rise and kiss GIOVANNI on the cheek. CHARLIE is very impressed at their respectful showing. The waitresses and everyone else in the club tre them all like royalty.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR approaches the table where CHARLIE, GIOVANNI, and MARIO are seated and greets them warmly.  OSCAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the menus away. I, personally do the cooking tonight.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine...that's why I'm here.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calamari?  OSCAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capozelle, Calamari...anything you want...  GIOVANNI (POURING WINE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR sits.  OSCAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giovanni...er...can I talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refering to CHARLIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIOVANNI nods his head yes.  OSCAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the place, Giovanni...
GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know all about it. We'll discuss it later.  OSCAR (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our arrangements about the place haven't changed, have they? I mean...  GIOVANNI (GOOD-NATUREDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, not at all...look, we leave it the way it is for now, we talk later, understand?  OSCAR (SOMEWHAT RELIEVED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Giovanni...I understand. I'll bring the clams now.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is visible awed by GIOVANNI and MARIO'S confidenc and power. He is behaving as if he were at a job interview...very formally. CHARLIE had often had dinner with his uncle but this time the conversation is more pointed. Their conversation is mostly in ITALIAN WITH ENGLISH TITLES. They are discusssing GROPPI'S suicide.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really couldn't believe it when you told me, you know that?  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he was always a little crazy... he puts a gun in his mouth... (HE SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...like your friend...comme si chiama...Henning? Heming?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hemmingway. Killed himself. I was more upset about that than about Groppi, that's for sure.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing to MARIO) You know, this boy over here, once, long time ago, tried to enrich my mind...so he gives me a book by this Hemin fella...to read, so I read it.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't a book...was a short story.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?  CHARLIE (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, c'mon...Y'know, I read.  CHARLIE (MUTTERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Francis Macomber."  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVERSATION IS NOW ENGLISH.
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber."  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah...didn't read it but I saw the movie...Gregory Peck...pretty good.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, Mario over here, he reads a lot.

dialogues.speaker: IN ITALIAN.
dialogues.text: GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised?  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this Harold Robbins...  CHARLIE (POLITELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, he's pretty good.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I don't understand is why you have to go to college to read these books that you're gonna read anyway.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a couple of courses...just for the draft.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, couple of courses isn't enough to get you student deferred... I mean if they wanted to draft you, you would've been drafted by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE feels that it would be better not to pursue the p  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Mario's trying to tell you, Charlie, is that you're wasting your time with those "couple of courses" ...you don't need them. There are a lot of things that can be taken care of...you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They become aware of the T.V. set which is on in the rear the back room where they are dining. The news is on...politics, society, and war.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These politicians...they talk nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE listen attentively, but obviously has heard GIOVANNI'S philosophy before.  GIOVANNI (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it's the same thing, all the same...they're in there by having something on somebody...and when that doesn't work...they fight...Our life has honor...we have no show to put on because we do what we have to do. They know where to come when they need us. I realize this during the war...World War II...Vito Genovese... during WWII he worked with the government, taking care of the docks...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he do?
GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he do? He was there... that's what he did.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the fifties when the communists started in with this country and they tried to clean them out, we offered to do it for them...but they didn't want us to...so we kept out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE nods.  GIOVANNI (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told this...the same thing to your father thirty years ago...I told him what to do...but he didn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation turns to more direct topics while they h their coffee and ainsette.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still around with that kid Johnny Boy...last night with that gun...Don't get mixed up with them. This Johnny Boy, you know, he's named after me... (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nice, eh? This Johnny Boy is like your mister Groppi...a little crazy. It's nice you should help him out because of his family and our family but watch yourself...Don't spoil anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE nods, feeling very uneasy.  GIOVANNI (CONFIDENTIALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His whole family has problems...his cousin, the girl who lives next door to you...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teresa.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The one who's sick, right? In the head.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's got epilepsy.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's what I said, sick in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE nods.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother and father come to me and ask advice...she wants to leave...get her own apartment...worries them sick...what am I gonna tell them? Lock her up?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they expect you to say?  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? It's not hard to figure out what she'll wind up like. When the respect for parents breaks down, that's bad...you know I'm "cumpari" with them...so I take an interest. You live next door, keep an eye open...but don't get involved.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take a look around the place if you want?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's ok...I've been in and out of this place fifty times.  GIOVANNI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you missed something?  CHARLIE (CATCHING ON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that's a possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE heads for the kitchen.  CHARLIE (CONFESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...looks good...things look good, if I may say so myself. Don't you agree? Unless there's something You know that I don't know?  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is examining the kitchen closely. A black cook is working hard, taking a piece of meat off the grill. He carefully prepares a dish.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE smiles and moves in closer to the grill. The cook is sweating and mopping his brow.  COOK (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's hot as Hell in here, every day like going through Hell in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE moves in closer and the COOK continues preparing food.  CHARLIE (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot as hell...You're not the only one going through Hell kid.  COOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe so...but at this pay it ain't worth it...that much I can tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE hasn't been listening to the COOK. He has become fascinated with the flames on the grill. They remind him an old device from his Catholic School days. CHARLIE brin his hand forward and closer to the fire, testing the pain the "Fires of Hell."  CHARLIE (CONFESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'If thy hand is an occasion of sin to thee, cut it off. It is better for thee to enter into life maimed than having two hands to go into hell, into the unquenchable fire. 'Where their worm dies not and the fire is not quenched.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE'S hand touches the flame. He winces. Music in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE, JOHNNY, TONY and JIMMY are driving along in TONY car. As they talk, a derelict takes advantage of a red light to wipe their windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY rolls up the window and rolls the car forward a bit force the derelict out of the way.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it near Sullivan Street?  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - by Bedford.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - you gotta show me. I always get lost in the village.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, bet with your own kind.  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number was 235 - I bet it combination.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be OK - I know those guys. They won't stiff you.  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet 235. Because I dreamt of my grandfather - and when he died, the number of the funeral parlour was 235 - so when I dreamt...  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah - enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the bar.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Charlie, you canonized yet?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - not yet - just blessed.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys are in mid-discussion.  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Friday, the 25th--I placed it WITH SALLY--  JOEY (BEING DISTRACT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of it.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Joey, really...we're all friends here--let's cut the bullshit.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begins to chuckle) ...Well... (TO JIMMY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you got a good friend here--come to think of it, I do remember now.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) SCUMBAG--  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nudging JOHNNY BOY) (under his breath) Shut up.  JOEY (MAKING EXCUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Friday's are busy--a mistake can be made y'know. Have another drink.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, just lets settle this and it's all forgotten.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't forget nothin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY looks at JOHNNY BOY but decides to let it pass. CHAR gives JOHNNY BOY a dirty look. Music is playing on a juke box. Several girls stand nearby listening to both the mus and the discussion. JOHNNY BOY looks over at them and the at JOEY.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower the fuckin music--I can't hear nothin.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls like it loud.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls? You call those skanks girls?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY, his friends, and the girls all look up. JOEY'S attitude changes.
JOEY (TO CHARLIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with this kid?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel fine--nothing wrong with me.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your mouth shut.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me that in front of these creeps?  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't pay...  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? We just said...  JOHNNY BOY (INTERRUPTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't pay...because this guy (pointing to JIMMY) is a...mook.  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't say nothin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fellows look at each other bewildered.  JOEY (TO JIMMY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't pay mooks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows what a mook is. JIMMY'S attitude now changes  JIMMY (ANGRILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mook...I'm a mook... (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a mook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE can no longer control the situation as tempers ri  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't call me a mook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIMMY swings at JOEY. A fight breaks out. JIMMY, CHARLIE, TONY and JOHNNY BOY are beaten. CHARLIE, not badly hurt manages to calm everything down. The police arrive to bre up the fight. People look iin as the two cops walk into t bar. The boys stop fighting immediately as they see the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, they treat CHARLIE and the others as friends-- helping them up off the floor, dusting off the clothes, e The police search everyone. When they ask who started it- what happened, etc. everybody including CHARLIE and the others cover for everyone else. "It was a joke officer" "He's my cousin" "We were just kidding," etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops nod. "Play nice now" and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone apologizes to each other. They drink again. JOHNNY BOY doesn't say a word--just stares.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were gonna pay you Jimmy, we just don't like being moved in on.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- I'm movin' in on you? Let's have another drink and forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink again. JOEY gives JIMMY the money, JIMMY goes count it.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't count it...it's all there.  JOHNNY BOY (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it.  JOEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon - no bullshit - friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY extends his hand. JIMMY and CHARLIE shake. JOEY extends his hand to JOHNNY.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuckin' touch me - scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE and the others "Oh no."  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by a flying fist. The fight breaks out anew. They barely make it to the door. JIMMY is out first with his cash. They run down the street. The west side boys don't chase them but stand by their bar shouting aft them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY is laughing as he runs. CHARLIE yells at him.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some mouth!  JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, you're a real jerk-off.  JOHNNY BOY (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're ya hollering? You got your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the car. TONY heads in first behind the wheel.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to take off) Fuck youse all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others jump in.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got no honor Tony. Charge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garbage and garbage pails are tosses after them as the bo take off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TONY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead guitarist holds his guitar out like a machine gu and strums frantically on it swinging it back and forth a the audience and then at the rest of the group. As he doe so, the rest of the group falls "dead" over their instrum The number is over and they all get up. The place is empt except for CHARLIE, TONY, and a few others, all of whom h been listening to the band. They applaude.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is talking to the leader of the group.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really, I liked it...thought it was great.  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your plans?  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're here for about two weeks, then whatever else comes along... we're still working on our album and...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...great...listen, I'm very interested in you guys because I'll be opening a new club myself soon... uptown...and maybe we can work something out...  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, 'The Season of the Witch' won't be ready for a while yet but we have to keep in touch.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is calling TERESA. The rock group is taking a bre before their evening performance and they can be heard breaking up the session in the background. TONY and the others are getting the tables ready.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teresa?...Yeah, Charlie. Listen, I'm looking for your cousin. Yeah, well today's Tuesday, payday. I haven't seen him all day...no...well, have you got any idea where he is? I know it's early yet but I'm just getting worried that's all...  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie...I've got to see you. I want to talk...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I can't talk now...I've gotta run, bye.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE can see the Negro stripper, DIANE, down the hall, her dressing room. She is putting on her makeup. CHARLIE is still very attracted to her. He enters her room.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diane, how are you feeling?  DIANE (COLDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CHARLIE continues to talk to her she undresses and beg to get into her first costume. CHARLIE feels slightly uncomfortable.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Diane...I've been wanting to talk to you for a while now...er... a... (she is undressing) aside from all that joking around we do out there...when you're on...I... a...I really...think that you're a terrific performer...  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious...You're really good.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a little while...I'm gonna have the opportunity of opening my own place...not here...much nicer than this...uptown...sort of nite-club and restaurant and everything.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.
CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe you'd do very nicely for the place.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stripper?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no stripping...as the hostess.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostess?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know...you greet the people...see them to their tables... well...it'll be different though... Listen...why don't we get together and talk after your show tonight.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinese food?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Chinese. We'll meet on the corner of 6th Avenue and Waverly Place after you finish.  DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not here...Ok nevermind...6th Avenue and Waverly.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE bumps into MICHAEL and a friend as he is leaving.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be seeing you and Johnny tonight... here...right?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL is sarcastic. He points to the parked car in fron of him.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, Charlie. If that kid doesn't show up tonight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL'S plan is seen on the screen as he speaks.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm gonna find him, drag him down here, tie one of his legs to that Ford bumper over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is dragged to the car and MICHAEL'S friend tie his leg to the car.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and his other leg to that Chrysler over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY'S other leg is tied to the Chrysler.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and bam!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a close-up of a foot slamming down on the gas peda twice. One car heads for the West Side--the other to the East Side. Tires screech and exhaust fumes fill the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three laugh.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Michael, I'll get him here. What do you want me to do, kill him?  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE leaves.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is on the phone trying to locate JOHNNY BOY. TERE is pacing back and forth nervously in the background. CHARLIE hangs up.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he didn't say anything to you about tonight?  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's Sakes...I told you before...nothing. (she moves closer) Charlie, I can't stay in here too long at this hour...will you please listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE turns and smiles at her. He kisses her because he doesn't feel like listening. TERESA is too preoccupied to respond. CHARLIE turns.  CHARLIE (MUTTERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that sonofabitch.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY walking through Greenwich Village looking arou as if being chased.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is kissing TERESA who is still very upset.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Charlie...it's uptown and it's perfect. It's big enough for two people...she's going to get out by the end of the month. If you don't act right away, it'll go in no time. What do you think?  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is making his way back to the apartment by sneaking along the sides of the buildings in the darkened street.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE tries to make love to TERESA out of his nervous energy and impatience at waiting so long for JOHNNY BOY. TERESA is rejecting his attempts.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY imagines he is being followed and dashes into door of a nearby building and up the stairs.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is doubly frustrated by TERESA'S rejection of his attempts at lovemaking because of his concern for JOHNNY He becomes sarcastic and abrupt.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize what that apartment means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE doesn't answer. TERESA continues.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? For both of us. Think... after a while you might even be able to move in yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE laughs. TERESA is visibly shaken but CHARLIE cann be bothered.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Me move in with you. You crazy?  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is silhouetted against the moonlight. He makes his way quietly over the roofs of the tenements and climb down CHARLIE'S fire escape.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (CONTINUES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teresa, get these ideas out of your head...I've got enough on my hands right now...with that bastard cousin of yours. You wanna move? Go ahead. By all means! But keep me out of it...I've got nothing to do with it...you understand...nothing.  CUT TO:  CHARLIE'S WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is at CHARLIE's window. Through it he can see TERESA lying on the bed in tears and CHARLIE pacing back forth across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is still talking loudly, JOHNNY BOY doesn't seem to pa any attention to the fact that TERESA is in CHARLIE'S bedroom. He opens the window and jumps in, smiling sarcastically. TERESA and CHARLIE are startled. CHARLIE grabs JOHNNY BOY by his coat collar.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you? Answer me, you sonofabitch! Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA is frightened and rushes towards CHARLIE. JOHNNY B reacts to the scene with uncontrolled laughter. CHARLIE i outraged and slaps him across the face but JOHNNY continu to laugh. TERESA screams.  CHARLIE (TO TERESA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  JOHNNY BOY (TO TERESA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Teresa, shut up! We don't wanna get Charlie here in trouble, do we?...We love Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE flings JOHNNY BOY against a wardrobe, letting go his collar.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had me going crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA is crying. JOHNNY goes into the kitchen and CHARLI follows. TERESA stays in the doorway.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY takes a drink of water from the sink as he tal CHARLIE is calmer now; calm enough to realize that JOHNNY has figured out his true relationship to TERESA. He tries to protect himself.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cousin here was getting sick, worrying about you. We've been in here calling...  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's too bad, Teresa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is embarrassed and TERESA is afraid.
JOHNNY BOY (CONTINUES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well kids...have the bans been announced yet?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be smart.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not smart...I'm stupid, remember. I'm so stupid that you have to look out for me, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA is crying.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be upset Teresa. You have to understand Charlie, here...he gives of himself to help others...  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go home.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you stay.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, I swear to God, if you open your mouth about any of this...  JOHNNY BOY (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I wouldn't say a word to my aunt and uncle...or even your uncle, Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA makes it to the door and opens it quickly. JOHNNY BOY grabs her to keep her from leaving. CHARLIE rushes towards them and pulls JOHNNY BOY away. By now, they are halfway down the hall.  JOHNNY BOY (SHOUTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie...I always wondered about her...what happens when she comes? Does she get one of those fits? Eh? That would be something to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is interrupted by CHARLIE'S fist as it lands a solid punch on the right side of his hand. TERESA screams and rushes to separate them.
JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rat bastard!! Don't hit me again!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stops.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I will fuckin go see your uncle right now...he'd be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE rushes JOHNNY BOY towards the stairs. They bump into TERESA, slamming her against the wall.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Go on! And we'll see what happens to you without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA is terrified that JOHNNY BOY will really go to CHARLIE'S uncle.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no...don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA falls, hitting the stairs with a thud. She lies there moaning and tossing her head. CHARLIE and JOHNNY BO go to help her.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do? You know anything about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY steps over TERESA to go down the stairs. He tu  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...she's your girl...I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is furious. JOHNNY BOY points to TERESA who is getting worse.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to miss the floor show, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE lunges out at JOHNNY BOY shoving him halfway down the stairs. He has gotten hold of his coat so that JOHNNY BOY can't leave. Neighbors from downstairs open their doo and come up the stairs. CHARLIE, in complete panic, tries to put something into TERESA'S mouth while holding JOHNNY BOY at the same time. He shoves his hand into her mouth trying to pry it open but she bites into it. CHARLIE screams as the blood streams out. He lets go of JOHNNY BO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors take over. One woman appears to know how to administer aid to TERESA.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is halfway down the stairs by now. The neighbo takes care of TERESA. While CHARLIE dashes down the stair CHARLIE grabs JOHNNY in the ground floor hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the deserted factory section of Manhattan, JOHNNY BOY CHARLIE stand next to a corregated metal garage door. CHARLIE smashes JOHNNY BOY against the door sending resounding echoes into the street.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy bastard! What are you trying to do, ruin me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is not fighting back anymore. He is on the ver of tears. CHARLIE smashes him against the door again--aga the crashing sound reverberates in the empty street.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, JOHNNY BOY is thrown up against the door.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threaten me with my uncle? After what I'm doing for you?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're doing for me isn't worth it...believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE slaps JOHNNY BOY and pushes him against the door again.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't show up tonight and see what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stops. He digs his hands into JOHNNY'S pockets bu he can't find anything.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much have you got for Michael tonight?
JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only got eight bucks on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stares at JOHNNY BOY for a moment then puts his h into his own pocket and pulls out three ten dollar bills three ones.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take twenty bucks. With your eight that makes twenty-eight bucks you give Michael. I keep the thirteen for the weekend. Maybe we'll eat some Chinese food later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY doesn't take it. CHARLIE forces it into his ha  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. I'm doing it for you, stupid!  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE, calmer now, is feeling ashamed.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, cut it out, will ya?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, twenty-eight bucks is nothing. The only way to do it is through your uncle...think about it will you?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!! What do you think I am, crazy???  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just want to help myself, that's all.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs JOHNNY BOY along.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. TONY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're over an hour late. Michael said he'll be back later, though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE takes a drink. JOHNNY BOY sits at the bar. The place is beginning to empty and the show is over. CHARLIE takes TONY aside.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this kid for me. I have to go someplace but I'll be back soon to get Michael and him together. Don't even let him go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to JOHNNY BOY.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you move!!!  JOHNNY BOY (SULKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be here. Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY orders a drink.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE gets into the cab.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6th Avenue and Waverly Place, fast please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab takes off. They soon arrive at their destination.  CAB DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE leans back into the seat and peeks out the window  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...don't stop...just pass real slow, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE looks out the window and sees DIANE, the negro stripper. She is standing on the corner waiting for him. CHARLIE nods his head for the driver to stop.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here. (HE HESITATES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...what am I...crazy??? Take me back to where you picked me up.
CAB DRIVER (SIGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives away, passing DIANE who is on the corner.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is back inside the club.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back so soon.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY sets up drinks for them and pours them into shot gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE strikes a match and lights each glass... little b flames dance along the rims of the glasses.  TERESA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cut it out. Will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows out the flames. CHARLIE moves to the other and o the room with his drink.  CHARLIE (CONFESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see things aren't going too well for me at the moment. My willpower and powers of persuasion are not what they usually are today. My ability to control events and situations are wanting. I know. I know...what can I say...I offer this as part of my penance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young couple, two of the few people left in the place, having a hushed quarrel at the end of the bar. The boy leaves for the men's room.  CHARLIE (TO TONY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the girl?  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewish...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?
TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She don't look Jewish.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she is. She's always in here with some different guy. You know the way they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE approaches the girl.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl looks at him, first embarrassed, then annoyed.  CHARLIE (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since that first day I saw you at the convent with the nuns, playing volleyball, I couldn't help myself.  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Italian?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah why?  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl laughs. Her boyfriend comes out of the men's roo He has her coat in his hand.  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Boy) Fuck off.  BOY (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? (he looks at CHARLIE) ...let's go.  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go...I'm staying.  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE reaches over and grabs the GIRL'S arm tightly. Sh looks up, startled, and the boy appears to be frightened.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious that the girl doesn't want to accompany you, isn't it?  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look fella...this is private...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's private...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRL is really scared now.  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE won't let go of her arm. She tries to pull away b his grip tightens.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether she wants to or not...she's not going.  BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRL is in tears.  GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it...you're hurting me.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her away from me...I mean physically take her away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is holding her so tightly that she is doubling over in pain. The BOY, although he is scared, lunges at CHARLIE. There is a brief scuffle which TONY breaks up.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is lifting the lid of a garbage pail. He takes out a brown paper bag and opens it. He takes a small .22 pistol from it and puts it inside his jacket, then replac the bag in the garbage pail.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL has entered the club. The BOY and GIRL are gone. TONY is with CHARLIE and JOHNNY BOY, whose return went unnoticed.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it gonna be? I was here tonight...you kept me waiting for over an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL has two friends with him.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Michael. I've got something for you...not much...but...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has about twenty-eight bucks... it's all he has on him.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY takes out a ten dollar bill and hands it to hi  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rest?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, where's the rest?  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought a few rounds of drinks while waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is stunned.  MICHAEL (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight bucks is enough of an insult...I was gonna take the twenty-eight bucks because of Charlie here...but ten bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL takes the ten dollars, crumples it and flings it into JOHNNY BOY'S face. JOHNNY BOY picks it up and slowly smooths it out. He sets it on fire as he talks.
JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make me laugh, Michael...you know that? I've borrowed money all over the neighborhood and never paid it back...so I couldn't borrow anymore from them...so who's the only jerk off left that I can borrow from without paying back...YOU. Because that's what I think of you...Jerk off. I fuck you where you breathe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL lashes out at JOHNNY BOY with the back of his han JOHNNY BOY tosses the flaming bill at MICHAEL and quickly pulls out his .22 pistol. Everyone is shocked.  CHARLIE (MUTTERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really crazy.  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to use that gun, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY doesn't answer but holds the gun straight at MICHAEL'S face. MICHAEL turns to go, defying JOHNNY BOY. His friends follow. When he reaches the doorway, he turns  MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have the guts to use that...be seeing you Charlie, Tony, and of course you John...be seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY is still frozen with the gun in his hand, poin it at mid-air. CHARLIE slams JOHNNY BOY across the face with his fist. TONY takes the gun from his hand.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid bastard! Never pull a gun unless you intend to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits JOHNNY BOY again.  TONY (HOLDING GUN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No bullets in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE hits JOHNNY BOY again.
TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here before this really goes up.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide the gun. Throw it away. Anything. Listen, I gotta borrow your car...I think we should take a ride...away from here for the night...you know what I mean?  TONY (RELUCTANTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok...but go to a movie first or something...not good to be driving around right away. You know you can't do much for him now...it's out of your hands.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young girl is in her room with her maid. The maid is helping her dress. Eerie music creates a frightening atmosphere. CHARLIE and JOHNNY BOY watch nervously affect by the film's mood. The theatre is a 42nd street one with lots of sleeping drunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the maid's face begins to contort as if she's seeing something horrible. The audience is on edge. The young girl sees the maid and shouts "What is it?" - but t maid only sneezes.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is driving. JOHNNY BOY is beside him in the front seat. The top od the car is down and CHARLIE is driving with no particular destination in mind.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should see your uncle.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be settled any other way now...I'll take full blame.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.
JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Hide me?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY turns away and tunes in the radio to a loud ro song.  CHARLIE (CONFESSION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could safely say that this evening has been so far very unimpressive as far as my efforts are concerned...more unproductive. Now, I'd like to know what you do, for an encore, Lord? I know penance is penance but this is something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHNNY BOY opens his eyes.  JOHNNY BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking to yourself???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns up the radio.  CHARLIE (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Play the radio...play music...you're going to a party... louder! Go ahead. Louder. A party. Lots of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black sedan has been driving along parallel to CHARLIE' car, unnoticed by CHARLIE. Otherwise the street is desert The car begins to drive CHARLIE off the road.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what is this guy, crazy?  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now's the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE turns his head to look. JOHNNY BOY looks up. They fire the gun.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A barage of bullets (5 gunshots) hit CHARLIE'S car. CHARL is hit in the hand. JOHNNY BOY has been hit in the throat He stands up and leans over the windshield of the car, spewing blood onto it and into the wind. He is screaming. The black sedan turns onto another street.  CUT TO:  TONY'S CONVERTIBLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is so shocked that the car is completely out of control. It goes screeching along the street, swerves, an slams into a fire hydrant, breaking it off and causing wa to shoot out onto the sidewalk, car and street. CHARLIE h been thrown from the car. He kneels in the street holding his wrist. He is on the yellow letters "FIRE LANE." JOHNN BOY lies against the side of a building--still. CHARLIE goes to the curb and sits there holding his bleeding hand The police arrive with their guns drawn.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the neighborhood, the religious fiesta is ending. The singers on the bandstand are singing the last song of the evening, "Vincino Amare." A crowd of elderly Italian- Americans stand below the bandstand and listen. There are four singers, their voices projected through a PA system.  MUSIC:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO:  TERESA'S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERESA is in bed, asleep. The music can be heard echoing the background.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is still sitting on the curb holding his injured wrist. The ambulance and the police are going about their business. A crowd has gathered.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIOVANNI is watching the Late Late Show on T.V. (Car explosion scene from "The Big Heat"). Aside from the ligh of the screen, the room is darkened.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANE is alone, sipping coffee.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are standing around CHARLIE with open notebook questioning him. He doesn't answer. JOHNNY BOY'S body is being taken into the ambulance.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY is relieving himself. He washes his hands.  CUT TO:  NEIGHBORHOOD STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last song of the festival is ending now. As the singe come to a stirring climax they wave and shout in Italian.  SINGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night...Good night...thank you...good night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band plays a few bars of "Home Sweet Home." The singe throw kisses to the dispursing crowd. People who have bee watching the festival pull down the blinds of shades and in.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL'S car is parked in a deserted area on the docks. has his head in his hands. The BOY with him says nothing.  CUT TO:  STREET CORNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is still in shock, sitting on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are still walking around in a businesslike man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stares down at his feet. The wrecked car is being pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE is being put into an ambulance. He is muttering t himself and seems shocked and bewildered.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning. A door in the far corner of the room opens CHARLIE is motioned through by a cop, who shuts the door immediately behind him. There is an unnaturally loud clanging sound that echoes in the room. CHARLIE looks around, still a little dazed, and spots MARIO standing ov by the door. MARIO has made no move to greet him. He just stands there watching. CHARLIE walks over to him, sensing something a little ominous.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle didn't come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIO says nothing, just nods at him to step outside. CHARLIE goes out into the street. MARIO follows.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is practically no one on the street. The early morning light makes everything a clammy grey. CHARLIE wai at the bottom of the steps.  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses for a moment) Giovanni says now he done enough. He got you outta jail. Now... (reaching in pocket) he wants you outta the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIO hands CHARLIE an envelope containing an airline tic  MARIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says use it. Don't sell it. He says he'll see you. Someday. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stares at the ticket in his hand. MARIO is obviou uncomfortable.  MARIO (ABRUPTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things worked out rotten kid. Sorry.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY'S car. He is driving CHARLIE to the airport. A suitcase can be seen in the back seat.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?  CHARLIE (PREOCCUPIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kennedy.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be jolly) I know, I know, stupid. I mean where you goin'?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an open ticket. I can go anywhere up to $350.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  CHARLIE (EDGY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll send you a postcard from wherever. If I get there.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You flew before?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE'S face - slightly upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE snapping seat belt in car.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOCK SHOT: airplane exploding BLACK AND WHITE (FANTASY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE in car - more upset.
CHARLIE (IRRITATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on...  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. I only asked because maybe I could, you know, let you have a little something.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well thanks, but I got enough to hold me. My mother can send me some. I don't know.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Teresa? I could talk...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to be impatient) Listen, I appreciate it, but I'll handle it myself. I'll write.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And say what?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say that I'm travelling.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWA terminal at Kennedy. TONY'S car pulls up to the curb, CHARLIE gets out, waves away help from an idle port and pulls his suitcases out of the back seat. TONY leans across the seat toward him.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, try a place with some sun. Swimming pools. Palm trees. Girls in little French bathing suits.  CHARLIE (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE breaks away from the handshake and grabs TONY affectionately behind the neck.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of that tiger.
TONY (CORRECTING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panther...  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panther! Same thing...  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...no more good times like before. Until you come back.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. And you're gonna take the vows next Tuesday, right.  TONY (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm gonna worry about you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY gives CHARLIE'S hand a last slap, then gets back beh the wheel.  TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE nods and watches the car pull away. Then he picks up his bag from the sidewalk and walks into the terminal.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is huge and there is a lot of bustle and excite CHARLIE is noticeable because he is the only member of th crowd who walks slowly, without any apparent mission or destination. He makes his way toward the large flight boa that looms over the whole room. Loudspeakers announce planes to and from every part of the world. On the flight board, the origins and destinations of the days flight sp and change every moment. He passes the insurance machines and almost stops - more upset than before. A businessman calmly pays for insurance. (Muzak is heard) CHARLIE continues on past a novelty shop where some plastic cross and St. Christopher medals hang alongside the stuffed toy dogs and flight bags. He looks at the cross.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ticket desk is under the flight board. CHARLIE eventu works his way over to the desk, drops his bag on the floo and stands staring at the board. He sees the names of dozens of cities flashing before him. As he watches, a pretty ticket clerk speaks to him from behind the desk.
CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE stares at the flight board in dismay and indecisi He apparently does not hear her.  CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE hears her this time. He reaches into his jacket pocket and pulls out the ticket which he passes across to her. The clerk starts to open it to check the destination  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (questioning, challenging) Where can I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is unusual. The clerk looks up. CHARLIE star back at her with a quality that is almost defiance.  CUT TO:
